keyPolicies.policyDescription: Voted against Labour plans to put up Council Tax this year above the Welsh average while they cut services and increase charges.
Opposed the hike in car parking charges at a time when town centres desperately need to attract shoppers.
Supported pupils of Ysgol Gyfun Rhydfelen fighting to keep the name of their school – where Labour did it regardless.
Called for a judicial review of the way the planning decision which closed one of the last green spaces of open from the Rhondda area (Labour said no).
Condemned spending on art projects which basis scientific reality.
Spoken out against fabrications and dishonesty in politics.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Take a good look at the other candidates and ask yourself – where have they been until now? Both Plaid and the Conservative candidates are failed Cardiff Council candidates with no previous interest in this area.

politicalExperience.role: County Borough Councillor for the Trallwn ward
politicalExperience.achievements: Mike has been the County Borough Councillor for the Trallwn ward since 1999.

quotes.text: "The biggest single disappointment of my career as an MP was when we were managing to get to grips with various local issues and suddenly when our industries were reshaped, that became a special blow. We need to see positive schemes which provide pride in new industry, in creative industries and hi-tech industries."
